<div class="project">
<div class="position-line">
Post-HCT Survival Predictions using Machine Learning and Deep Learning \| 2025
</div>
<div class="company-line">
<a href="https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/equity-post-HCT-survival-predictions" target="_blank">Kaggle CMBTR Challenge</a>, Silver Medal (74/3084)
</div>
-  The aim of this project is to develop advanced survival predictive models for almost 30,000 allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplant (HCT) patients collected from CIBMTR.
-   Proposed a solution for Silver Medal by ensembling multiple ML/DL models including Light GBM with Kaplan Meier transformation and XGBoost-based cox model, accelarated failure model and deep learning based survival prediction model. \| **Solution Report: [CMBTR-Survivor](https://github.com/cmbtr-2025/CMBTR-Survivor){target="_blank"}**
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="project-card">

<div class="project-main">
<div class="experience-container">
<div class="project">
<div class="position-line">
Predict Protein-molecule Interaction for New Medicines using Deep Learning \| 2024
</div>
<div class="company-line">
<a href="https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/leash-BELKA" target="_blank">Kaggle BELKA Challenge</a>, Bronze Medal (178/1950)
</div>
-  The aim of this project is to develop predictive models for estimating small molecule binding affinity to protein targets using the BELKA dataset to accelerate drug discovery.
-   Developed an ensemble approach combining 1D CNN, Transformer, and Mamba architectures with character-level tokenization of SMILES strings for molecular sequence encoding to achieve robust multi-label classification performance. \| **Solution Report: [BELKA-2024](https://github.com/belka-2024/BELKA-2024){target="_blank"}**
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="project-main">
<div class="experience-container">
<div class="project">
<div class="position-line">
Financial Crime Prevention using Secure AI \| 2024
</div>
<div class="company-line">
<a href="https://www.nist.gov/itl/applied-cybersecurity/privacy-engineering/collaboration-space/challenges/us-uk-pets-prize" target="_blank">US-UK PETs Challenge</a>, 1st Place (10,000 USD)
</div>
-  The aim of this project is to develop privacy-preserving federated learning solutions for detecting anomalous financial transactions to combat international money laundering.
-   Designed privacy-preserving federated XGBoost using Bloomfilter for secure anomalous financial transactions detection. \| **Solution Report: [Scarlet-PETs](https://github.com/usnistgov/PrivacyEngCollabSpace/tree/master/tools/de-identification/Scarlet-PETs){target="_blank"}**
</div>
